keyMoments.title: Don Krieg's First Full Appearance
keyMoments.description: Don Krieg enters the Baratie in a weakened state, introducing himself as the admiral of the most powerful pirate fleet in East Blue.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of a major arc villain with command of 5,000 pirates and 50 ships.
keyMoments.quote: I am Don Krieg, admiral of the pirate fleet. I command 5,000 men and 50 ships.

keyMoments.title: Krieg Begs for Food
keyMoments.description: Despite his fearsome reputation, Krieg humbles himself to beg for food, promising not to attack if fed.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the moral dilemma and demonstrates Krieg's willingness to use any tactic to achieve his goals.
keyMoments.quote: Please... just give us food and water. I promise we won't attack your ship.

keyMoments.title: Krieg's Betrayal
keyMoments.description: After eating and regaining strength, Krieg immediately betrays the Baratie, revealing his true intentions to seize the ship.
keyMoments.significance: Confirms Krieg's ruthless, dishonorable character and starts the major conflict.
keyMoments.quote: Did you really think I'd keep my word? I'm a pirate!

bounties.reason: Admiral of the largest pirate fleet in East Blue, known for ruthless tactics and military conquest

abilities.description: Golden wootz steel armor containing multiple hidden weapons including firearms, flamethrower, poison gas, and various other armaments.

relationships.description: Gin serves as Krieg's combat commander and right-hand man, showing loyalty despite Krieg's ruthless nature.

evolutionMoments.description: Gin accompanies Krieg to the Baratie in their weakened state.

reveals.information: Known as 'Foul-Play Krieg' for using deception and dishonorable tactics
Commands a fleet of 50 ships with 5,000 pirates, the largest in East Blue
17,000,000 berries - highest bounty revealed in the series so far
Recently returned from the Grand Line after his fleet was decimated, leaving only about 100 survivors

keyMoments.title: Sanji Feeds Krieg
keyMoments.description: Sanji defies the warnings of all the Baratie staff to feed the starving Don Krieg, demonstrating his unwavering philosophy.
keyMoments.significance: Defines Sanji's core character principle that will remain central throughout the series - never refusing food to the starving.
keyMoments.quote: When people are hungry, I offer them food. That's all there is to it.

relationships.description: Sanji and Zeff have a complex father-son-like relationship marked by constant bickering but deep mutual respect.

evolutionMoments.description: They argue about Sanji's priorities, but Zeff ultimately supports Sanji's decision to feed Krieg.

reveals.information: Sanji's core philosophy is revealed: a cook must feed anyone who is hungry, regardless of who they are or what they've done

keyMoments.title: Returns with Don Krieg
keyMoments.description: Gin returns to the Baratie with his captain Don Krieg, both in a starved and weakened state.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Gin's loyalty to his captain while setting up internal conflict given Sanji's earlier kindness to him.

bounties.reason: Combat commander of the Krieg Pirates

relationships.description: Gin is loyal to Don Krieg as his combat commander and right-hand man.
Gin feels gratitude toward Sanji for feeding him in Episode 21, creating internal conflict with his loyalty to Krieg.

evolutionMoments.description: Gin witnesses Sanji's kindness being repaid with Krieg's betrayal, deepening his internal conflict.

keyMoments.title: Zeff Agrees to Krieg's Demands
keyMoments.description: Faced with Krieg's overwhelming firepower, Zeff pragmatically agrees to provide food for the pirate's crew to protect his staff.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zeff's leadership prioritizing his people's safety over pride.
